abstract: JPMorgan Chase files lawsuit to block Indian real estate developer Kabul Chawla from transferring ownership of $19.4 million condominium at Time Warner Center in Manhattan; move is first step in attempt to seize apartment for partial payment of $90 million Chawla was ordered to pay to Chase by Indian court; Chawla's ownership of apartment was uncovered by New York Times investigation.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase wants to seize the condo as a partial payment for a $90 million award against an Indian real estate developer, who denies owning the property.

headline.main: JPMorgan Sues to Prevent Transfer of $19.4 Million Condo at Time Warner Center
headline.print_headline: JPMorgan Sues to Prevent Transfer of $19.4 Million Condo at Time Warner Center

snippet: JPMorgan Chase wants to seize the condo as a partial payment for a $90 million award against an Indian real estate developer, who denies owning the property.
